This course satisfies the Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Christianity, Theme. 
Topic: The Bible in Current Controversies
There has been no such time as the present when faith has become viewed as the most contradictory way to make sense of the world. Many people claim to espouse biblical values to support such beliefs. Then, is the Bible itself the root of controversies? In attempting to answer, this course will examine what the Bible has to say about several controversial issues such as Bible vs. science, abortion, homosexuality, violence, and gun control. Students will reflect on the difficulty of identifying a single, or even a dominant, biblical perspective on such issues. In addition to the Bible itself, the class will survey diverse articulations and current receptions of the Bible, including verbal, visual, ritual, and in-person accounts. Through this public-facing observation, students will develop skills to assess the (ir-)relevance of the biblical texts to the modern debates.
